intro: Lunathyrium centrochinense, commonly known as the Guangdong bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
